ygData.msgSnippet: Jotunn thought for a moment. Jotunn: The Watchers play an important rule, even though they tend to break all the fun in the game. The Pacificus are a mere

Subject: Re: Balistica up and running
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=225937926; y=a_tbguW0dZGrbkG30LmwSOksZfCycyvk2XRPeEAhhRgZV4KV6Kni
X-Yahoo-Profile: warriorazure

Jotunn thought for a moment.

Jotunn: The Watchers play an important rule, even though they tend to
break all the fun in the game. The Pacificus are a mere nuisance. If
we have something to fear, it is from the Silver Wings. They have the
army and the power to thwart our plans and foil our defences.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Airly" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Trooper:
> 
> "What maximals faction have to... find her, sir? Silverwings,
Pacificus or better... Watchers??" asked the male
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Nic 
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Sunday, July 17, 2005 10:42 AM
>   Subject: Re: Balistica up and running
> 
> 
>   Jotunn lifted his massive and brutish form from the throne he had been
>   seated in. He commanded the bay window to open, and light started
>   flooding the room.
> 
>   Jotunn: You have good ideas, soldier, but you must push your thoughts
>   further... Erase her memories, implant the spy relay. Alol that she
>   will experience will be sent to our computers. Also...
> 
>   He turned to the trooper for the first time, revealing a monstruous
>   visage.
> 
>   Jotunn: ... hide a helium bomb in her. It has to be undetectable and
>   devastating at the same time. She will be our first blow on the
>   Maximals when we are ready.
> 
>   --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Airly" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
>   > Trooper:
>   > 
>   > "YEs sir... if you let me..."said the trooper doubing"The femme
>   could be usefel, even if she refuses; you see, perhaps if we erase her
>   memories until she arrived here and set her in stasis... we could gave
>   her to Pacificus Maximals or even Silver wings... If we instal a chip,
>   she could help us to spy those factions and that would let us crush
>   them or in case that situation is needed, she could be a lil gift of
>   peace to other Maximal faction but her presence here must be
hidden...."
>   >   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   >   From: Nic 
>   >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   >   Sent: Saturday, July 16, 2005 10:14 AM
>   >   Subject: Re: Balistica up and running
>   > 
>   > 
>   >   Jotunn: This is surprising news indeed... Here are my orders:
install
>   >   a Loyalty chip in this Windlord. He must be brought under my
control!
>   >   After that, activate him. He will still think he is a maximal,
but he
>   >   will think our option is the best one. Try to make him convert
>   >   Balistica. If she doesn't join... terminate her. Understood?
>   > 
>   >   --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Airly" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
>   >   > Trooper:
>   >   > 
>   >   > "YEs sir"replied the male while he looked those scary red
eyes"One
>   >   of the maximals, the somehow useless, it's a femme, her name is
>   >   Balistica., I'm not very clear with her backgroud: it seems
that she
>   >   came her behind someone very important in Cybertron council; she's
>   >   actually, funcional and under a high vigilance;  I don't like
that she
>   >   go around and lost. The other one is a male; his current status is
>   >   stasis lock, I guess that it's the best, sir, but he has a tight
>   >   vigilance too. Acording with data banks that was taken from
the ruins
>   >   from he comes, his name is Windlord and was here before that
the lost
>   >   ones come to this planet and his joined them, and he
participates in
>   >   most battles before our arrival, in his data banks showed that
he an a
>   >   femme were Unicron's prisioners, but they ran away, after that his
>   >   records are destroyed...  "
>   >   >   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   >   >   From: Nic 
>   >   >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   >   >   Sent: Friday, July 15, 2005 5:46 PM
>   >   >   Subject: Re: Balistica up and running
>   >   > 
>   >   > 
>   >   >   The room was dark. The air was damp, as if there was a jungle
>   in it.
>   >   >   Yet, at the same time, there was a chilling breeze passing
>   through the
>   >   >   room. Then, something moved, and two huge red eyes were
>   looking at the
>   >   >   trooper.
>   >   > 
>   >   >   Jotunn: Tell me more... What are their names, and which is
>   which? What
>   >   >   is their potential? Answer me...
>   > 
>   > 
>   > 
>   > 
>   >
>
